pros: There is not a single good thing I could say about this job.
cons: This company should be shut down. The things I had to deal with while working there have left me with my own trauma that I need therapy for. Can’t think of any reasons someone wouldn’t want to work here

review_title: In it for the right reasons
job_title: Therapeutic Staff Support in Danville, PA
pros:
This agency truly cares about the care, support, and treatment of children in NEPA as well as their families. They are expanding infrastructure and positions and, from what I have seen, compensate employees very fairly compared to others (i.e., paying above what Medicaid provides for face-to-face care). 

Also, HR and IT are responsive for employees who aren't on sight regularly. They get back to you quickly and answer questions fully.
cons: This is more a criticism of Medicaid's system, but it is somewhat disquieting that a TSS will not get any raises since it's a state-controlled compensation.

job_title: Behavioral Health Worker in Wilkes-Barre, PA
pros: CEO cares about employees, company offers numerous perks, ex. discount tickets to sporting events, theme parks, shows, Get Healthy Incentives, 3% annual raise, four weeks vacation after 5 years.
cons: Management is not helpful, supervisors are incompetent. The company will hire anyone who meets minimum requirements (or sometimes even those who don't) regardless of experience, professionalism, maturity. Supervisors play favorites, treat different staff members unequally, and management allows this.

review_title: Awful, I would not wish this on my worst enemy!
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Wilkes-Barre, PA
pros: They will hire anyone even unqualified because they are desperate to fill positions.
cons: Hostile environment. Poor compensation. Negative and fearful culture. Upper management worries about money, productivity, and what they want; they do not focus on the strengths of employees or their needs as humans. Upper management things they are number one and the greatest organization. It is not.

pros: Tons of positions available because nobody wants to stay or work there
cons: Hostile and toxic work environment. Fails to build professionals. Poor example set by upper management.
